intro: Browallia pulchella, commonly known as the common browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers come in shades of blue, purple, and white, often with a contrasting throat. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
